pyrecipe.gui package¶

Submodules¶

pyrecipe.gui.add_recipe module¶

The add_recipe module include classes to add or edit a recipe

class pyrecipe.gui.add_recipe.AddRecipe(source='')[source]¶

Bases: tkinter.Toplevel

Add a recipe.

The AddRecipe class is a toplevel dialouge used to add a recipe to the recipe store. If a source argument is passed with the class instance, a dialouge is produced with fields aleady populated with the relavant information.

add_ingredient(event='')[source]¶

class pyrecipe.gui.add_recipe.IngredTree(master=None, **kw)[source]¶

Bases: tkinter.ttk.Treeview

A simple editable treeview

It uses the following events from Treeview:
<Button-1>

The first is used to configure cell editors. The second is called after a cell was changed. You can know wich cell is being configured or edited, using:

get_event_info()
delete(*items)[source]¶

Delete all specified items and all their descendants. The root item may not be deleted.

xview(*args)[source]¶

Update inplace widgets position when doing horizontal scroll

xview_moveto(fraction)[source]¶

Adjusts the view in the window so that FRACTION of the total width of the canvas is off-screen to the left.

xview_scroll(number, what)[source]¶

Shift the x-view according to NUMBER which is measured in “units” or “pages” (WHAT).

yview(*args)[source]¶

Update inplace widgets position when doing vertical scroll

yview_moveto(fraction)[source]¶

Adjusts the view in the window so that FRACTION of the total height of the canvas is off-screen to the top.

yview_scroll(number, what)[source]¶

Shift the y-view according to NUMBER which is measured in “units” or “pages” (WHAT).
